WorkItem.Summary: Unit Testing WPF Prism based application

Comments.Message:
Hi,

For those interested in this subject, additionally to the links that Fernando Antivero suggested in this related thread (http://compositewpf.codeplex.com/discussions/222571), you could also find the following articles interesting:

Unit Tests for ViewModels AND Views in Silverlight:

http://csharperimage.jeremylikness.com/2009/12/unit-tests-for-viewmodels-and-views-in.html

Silverlight Unit Testing Framework: Asynchronous Testing of Behaviors:

http://www.wintellect.com/CS/blogs/jlikness/archive/2010/01/07/silverlight-unit-testing-framework-asynchronous-testing-of-behaviors.aspx

Also, I believe you could find useful information, on helper classes such as the PropertyChangeTracker tracker class in the following section of the Prism documentation, which provides guidance on unit testing application's view model and model classes, and on testing behaviors:

6: Advanced MVVM Scenarios, Testing MVVM Applications:

http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/gg405494(v=pandp.40)#sec19

Also, regarding how to create mock objects, take into account that the Prism guidance doesn’t provide any particular information about it. However, for more detailed information about mocking, I believe you could check the following articles:

Exploring The Continuum Of Test Doubles 

http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/magazine/cc163358.aspx

Advanced Unit Testing, Object Mocking, Profiling Your Apps and More 

http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/magazine/cc135981.aspx#S2

Regards,

Agustin Adami
http://blogs.southworks.net/aadami
